alert.note: Alert for Burke (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 21 at 11:48AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central Georgia and central South Carolina, including the following areas, in east central Georgia, Burke, Columbia, Lincoln, McDuffie and Richmond. In central South Carolina, Aiken, Bamberg, Barnwell, Calhoun, Central Orangeburg, Edgefield, Lexington, McCormick, Newberry, Northwestern Orangeburg, Richland and Saluda. * WHEN...Through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A deep area of low pressure over Georgia today will move very little over the next 24 to 36 hours. This will keep a deep plume of moisture in place across the region. In addition, a nearly stationary frontal boundary near the area will potentially enhance shower and thunderstorm activity this afternoon and tonight. Much of the region has already received 2 to 4 inches of rainfall with some locally higher amounts over the past 48 hours. With soils already saturated along with the threat for additional heavy rainfall the watch will continue. Additional rainfall amounts from 1 to 3 inches will be possible in the Central Savannah River Area into the southern Midlands and Piedmont of South Carolina. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
